title: Stop reporting people
body: Just play the game, who cares about flaming, trolls, and whatever else? It is all just a game, try to have fun with it. No one needed a report button before.

replies.body: {{champion:267}} Locking this necro.
I tend to have less fun in the game when people are flaming/trolling me.

It is a highly competitive game, people are going to blow off steam in one way or another. The report system was a bad idea from the start. We never needed it before, and the community is identical to other communities that don't have it. Actually, it is probably making things worse given how toxic reporting culture is.

And that’s fine, so long as their blowing off steam doesn’t involve blowing it in my face. Imagine this - the “flamer” is someone who smokes cigarettes. I’m all for it. If they need a cigarette, they’re more than welcome to go outside to smoke. If I’m outside too, I’ll deal with it. But when they intentionally blow their cigarette smoke in my face knowing that they could just blow it the other direction, that’s when it’s a problem.

The report system has been in place since League started, so there’s not a “never needed it before”. And I think you’ll be **very** hard pressed to find some community that doesn’t have any form of report system for players who are toxic.

If we are using RL comparisons then the report abusers can be looked at in the same vane as people that pretend to be victims in order to get people in trouble and punished for mild things like jokes they didn't like. Reporting someone is not mandatory, so why would anyone use it knowing that they would get someone in trouble and hurt them much more then some flaming or trolling would? I can't help but feel that anyone that would knowing get someone banned for such things are doing for with bad intentions in mind. 

The only exception i can really think of would be cheating, since that is going far out of the way to ruin the game for others. more so then running it down mid
There is no pretending. There are actual victims. This is a video game that people play to have fun. If people are not having fun because of flaming, that’s a problem.

If you want to call it a problem that is fine, but it would only be a problem for that person for 1 game. Once they are out of it, they are unlikely to meet that person again. being annoyed is only temporary, and the report is something that is done after the game ends. if the person get in trouble, it won't undo the annoyance, and because of how many players there are, it was unlikely the person would see them again even if they didn't report. Reporting doesn't fix the issue, it just gives the person that did it a sense of justice or revenge. 

And i will address that yes, those people that fall under the report system deserve it. if they can't control themselves enough times that they get banned, well they were warned over and over again. But then you have cases like that singed player, who did singed support that riot banned for playing off meta. and the people that got banned for finding an exploit in the ascension game mode. Didn't seem fair in the slightest to many people, me included.

It isn’t though. The vast majority of toxic players are not toxic in only one game. They will be toxic the next game. Or the game after that. Or the game after that.

It’s only a problem for *that person* for one game. But it’s a problem for *players* for all the games those players are in. Reporting *does* fix the issue - over 80% of punished players never get punished again. This holds for every level of punishment - less than 0.006% of players are *continually* toxic enough to be permanently banned - meaning that most players actually fix their behavior before that.

Singed support was unbanned, by the way, as it was in error, and the players banned for exploiting a bug were banned because Riot warned them to stop exploiting it, and they refused to stop exploiting git prior to a patch.

It is good to hear that the singed played got back in. Has RIot done anything to prevent the Ascension exploit? 

The 80% stat could just be due to people that get reported are not toxic people, only that they had a lapse in judgement. I try my best to be a model summoner, but I know I have my faults. Never got in trouble for any of them, but I know I have said things I wouldn't normally say. And I am sure most who have been playing s long as i have can relate.

So if only 0.006% of players are so bad that they get the permaban hammer, seems a lot less of a problem then it is made out to be. Though I would like a citation to the stats you have please, I am only speculation here

AFAIR (as far as I remember) the bug was patched in the next patch (if not before).

I will concede that there are players that have a lapse in judgement but get punished. However, by and large, the vast *vast* majority of players who are punished are not those with one “lapse” in judgement, but those who have continual lapses or lack the judgement to begin with. And that’s really the problem - the problem is that even those who have a lapse in judgement thought it was okay to flame. It is **never** okay to do - anyone who thinks otherwise has an attitude incompatible with League.

The stats are from the punishment reform cards, and there’s various posts from Lyte and others on the old boards (which I don’t have readily available right now) confirming them.

> Just play the game, who cares about flaming, trolls, and whatever else?

Only the vast majority of the community. Like 99.9% of it.

> It is all just a game, try to have fun with it.

I would, but flamers and trolls and cheaters ruin that fun. Which is why they deserve to get reported (and banned).

> No one needed a report button before.

Before what? Because the report button has been around for a loooooong time.
I played Halo 2 on Xbox Live. it was a great time and you never had to worry about some ass reporting your team because they are some kind of kill joy that doesn't understand gamer lingo
People used to report via xbox a lot.

Don't like being reported? Then don't be a douchebag.
Stop being an asshole, then you'll stop being reported. 

Simple.
A simple mutual understanding.

Only people will report you for anything and everything all the time. How many games have you been in where someone said "please report X" at some point in the game? It happens way too often, and i wonder about what affect it is having on the player's mentally. It makes the game less fun because no one can be clear on what is just fun banter, and what is gonna get them in trouble. it is a real fear of people. It is not about assholes, it is about what is going to be seen as acceptable or not. Why should any one player be allowed to dictate another's language? What if enough people reported enough times that the words "douchbag" was now a bannable offence like the N-word is?

I've been here for 10 years with this account alone.
I've seen and been through it all. I've been reported for who knows what and endlessly for not playing by someone's standard. But I was punished once in 2011, after that, I read the ToU and followed it since. I still get reported for numerous reasons, but I've never been punished since. I've never done anything against the ToU. I ignore it when people say they're going to report me. I only report those who deserve it, not for those who ask for it. It's never a fear for me, for I have nothing to fear. You can 100x report me all at once, and it'll become as irrelevant as a fart in the wind. 

Also, I do not insult people in the game, because it's the inside the game. Stating a fact on a board discussion by telling people to not be a douchebag is nothing like saying any zero-tolerance words in the game or saying that word in general.

All you did was try and dance around the issue i brought up. If you missed it, the point I was making was that people report for the dumbest reasons. 1000s of them every day, maybe more. Maybe it doesn't have an effect on the severity of what is count as punishable, maybe it does. I worry that it does and that over time the things counted as reportable slides into things that were once not.

Didn't dance around anything.
I stated a fact and a solution. Nothing about it is complex.
First stop trying to make others feel miserable just because their choices or mistakes upset you. Then we'll talk.
what are you talking about?

People who advocate for the report feature to be taken away are usually the people who don't want to have to change their ways. Those ways tend to involve giving a teammate a "healthy dose" of flame or demeaning criticism when that teammate does something that the flamer disapproves of.

False reports don't do anything already, so people who don't need to change won't be punished. Only people who have done things that make others miserable wind up getting punished. And that's how it should be.

Edit: Translation of my first comment - 'When people stop trying to make others feel miserable, we can talk about getting rid of the report system.'
Well how about next time you make a comment, you don't jump to consultations. You can't just assume the worst in everyone.

There is no reason to change the report system. The only reason to do so would be to protect people who exhibit punishable behavior. However, that behavior is undesirable in the first place and the punishments were put in place _on purpose_ in order to deal with precisely those behaviors.

Removing the report system would enable people to behave far worse and do even more to ruin games for others, all without consequence.

So I issue a correction to my first sentence: there is no _good_ reason to change the report system. Only reasons that serve evil and stupid purposes.

I do not support flaming or cheating at all, but I dislike the language and tone policing that happens. There is just an atmosphere around the game at times. It makes it feel professional, like at a work place. It is easy enough to take on that, but at the same time it is a video game, and I worry about how it will effect more casual play. And if it will go farther then need be. Losing the words %%%%%% and %%%%%% are no big losses, even if i think it is funny seeing some edge lord throwing them out. It is already questionable if thinks like "gg ez" will get you in trouble, and that seems so mild. At what point will someone being offended by something someone else says will be taken too far.

I can respect you for being concerned about tone policing. That's absolutely something I can get behind. But it's important to differentiate between toxic behavior and non-toxic behavior. There's a middle ground and while it would be bad to punish everything too much, it would also be bad to not punish anything at all.

Advocating for the removal of the report system is not a good idea, in my opinion. And I'd wager that many others feel similarly about this.

But it's reasonable to _replace_ the report system with something that is equally (or more) effective. What would you propose instead?

I think it would go a long way if the report system was limited to flaming and cheating for starters. Saying bad words, or telling someone to kill themselves on their own is not that bad. But if it turns into flaming then it has some tangible effects on the game. And if trolling was added into the mix i'd be accepting of it being for people that run it down mid or some other way of advancing the enemy team like continuations Aniva walls. Those are my thoughts on a potential reporting reform. basically just remove hate speech, and unsportsmanlike like conduct from it.

I can agree that hate speech punishment is a mess, the use of hate speech shouldn't be punishable. The _malicious_ use of it (which would qualify as flaming anyways) should. If I understand you correctly, we may actually agree on this. But I don't want to put words in your mouth, so let me know if I understand you correctly there.

To me, the definition of flaming is anything said with the purpose of making another player feel terrible, or feel one's anger. Expressing a desire for someone else to hurt themselves or suffer misfortune _is_ a form of flaming, in my opinion. So I can't agree with removing that from the punishable list. I'd be willing to support the idea of taking better care to figure out if it was a joke or serious, and maybe giving more lenient punishments if it was a joke rather than the same punishment as actual malicious use of such phrases, but I'm not willing to support the complete removal of it from the list of punishable things.

I agree with what you said for the most part, but as somewhat of a stoic myself, I do not believe that words can cause harm. Your definition of flaming is fine, i'd be willing to compromise on it, but I'd look more to what the flaming is doing. If the person is in the chat so often he is not playing the game anymore, that is where I'd put it up to. 

And on hate speech, i never see it used in any malicious way. I doubt people scream %%%%%% out loud because they are homophobic, but because we have all been taught to view that word and %%%%%% in such a light that they are just the easiest words to use when  getting frustrated. And frankly, banning the use of the words outright is just encouraging their use more then just ignoring them would ever do.

###### I'm not the one downvoting you, just to be clear.

> [{quoted}](name=Clockwork Mouse,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GAs7zEJB,comment-id=0004000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-29T22:01:29.224+0000)

> I agree with what you said for the most part, but as somewhat of a stoic myself, I do not believe that words can cause harm. Your definition of flaming is fine, i'd be willing to compromise on it, but I'd look more to what the flaming is doing. If the person is in the chat so often he is not playing the game anymore, that is where I'd put it up to. 

Well there's sort of a problem there. Flaming doesn't harm stoics, but not everybody is a stoic. Some people can't help but react, just like some people can't help but flame in the first place. That's why we need systems in place to mitigate this, because it disrupts games for everyone - even the stoics - when people get into flame wars or spam harassment.

> And on hate speech, i never see it used in any malicious way. I doubt people scream %%%%%% out loud because they are homophobic, but because we have all been taught to view that word and %%%%%% in such a light that they are just the easiest words to use when  getting frustrated. And frankly, banning the use of the words outright is just encouraging their use more then just ignoring them would ever do.

I don't entirely know how I feel about that. I think that you're right that people use it because they think it's really bad and people say the worst things they can when they're the most upset. However it is a fact that our society does not tolerate that sort of language. The government tends to maintain it's own restrictions, but businesses frequently follow the crowd by restricting the sorts of things society as a whole tends to consider unacceptable. We can't really change the fact that Society doesn't tolerate it.

I think that the policies regarding it could be way better, but I cannot fathom where to even begin changing things, or even how to do it most effectively. I'm not sure it's even possible in the current social climate.

I think you are right about that. I may find it silly to be upset over insults or slurs, but it still disrupts the game. It is a fine line to walk for sure. you gotta define directly what is flaming in a way there is no debate over it. I think my way is still the most efferent, determine it by how much insulting and spamming is being done, then treating it any phrases or words with cretin severity. 

The political landscape seems to be changing currently. I am sure it has been a mess keeping up with it. I hope it changes enough to address these kinds to issues. I understand the need for a business and it's workers to hold themselves up to some strict standards though, i wouldn't want to go to a hotel where the f bomb was being dropped by the maids

I just got my second Instant Feedback Report this week. You ruin the game for the team, you get reported. That's it.
No.

Well I mean you do you EvilDustMan with the teemo icon. You seem pretty settled into being a deviant

with the new mute button, reporting has been a less used option, people care alot less about flamers and toxic people since they cannot interact with them.

People get less severe chat bans, that make them think about how they should behave, and most people do change!

if they don't, we go down to 2 different types of toxic:


1: In-game toxic

they flame about your skill and your In-game build/runes/champion/whatever, which is the most common, it *IS* a highly competitive game and its understandable to get pissed at teammates, but telling someone they are bad at (insert champion) or (insert lane) will often lead to them muting you and missing communication that you can be giving out and losing you the game, or they just quit and get banned, although its not good to quit a game, if i had chernobyl on my team, I would do the same.

2: RL toxic
people who are racist/sexist/ist, I'am in no way a SJW, but these are the worst type of people, they are unable to keep their polical perspectives in the real world and has to ruin in for other people, no one is happy when they are around.


people just don't want to be called garbage, maybe they want POSITIVE input from their teammates and don't mute everyone, but i see where you are coming from, its very possible for people to /muteall and not report anyone, but sometimes, they just piss off people so much that they feel the need to report a teammate.

just like the summoners code says:

_**enjoy yourself, but not at anyone elses expense.**_

Pretty much. I don't like reporting people for various reasons, and i'd love to see a reworking of it to more specific things like cheating, inting, and sever flaming. I didn't do a good job with my first post, but my main issues and worry is more the tone policing. I feel like people should be allowed to say whatever they want to say as long as they are not flaming. Banter is one of the most enjoyable parts in the game for me, and i don't want it to turn into a second workplace where joking around and talking the jive is punishable
Unfortunately because people are childish and try to ruin others games we have to report them so they are put in time out to hopefully reform their habits. So nah, I’m gonna keep reporting

> Unfortunately because people are childish and try to ruin others games

basically what the report system is there to do. Ruin other people's ideas of fun that don't mix well with other's sensibilities. You shouldn't have to worry about being reported every game. Flaming i do not support or cheating, but how far is too far? No one should be reported for anything outside of cheating.

We can’t just narrow it down to that because then people can feed all they want ruining people’s rank games with no consequence. Actions have consequences and it should exist in game and outside. So if you don’t wanna get reported or banned don’t do things that merit a ban.
